intro: Rinorea brachythrix, commonly known as the silky rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Rinorea brachythrix is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
